featured.text: During World War II, Japan seized much of Southeast Asia’s rubber.

This was to ensure that no single and powerful noble family could seize the title and pass it to the next generation.
In 1884, Carl Elsener, head of the Swiss knife manufacturer Victorinox, seized that opportunity with both hands, and designed a soldier’s knife that the army loved.

definition.en_def: To take hold of suddenly and forcibly.
definition.example: The police decided to seize the stolen goods.
